Description: Temptation of St Antony; the saint seated at l, surrounded by beasts, a nude woman crouched beside a frog at r Oil
Curator's comments: For an introduction to the series of St Antony, see under no. 1907-7-17-42. Here the saint is on the left of the composition is sitting on a stone (as in nos. 1907-7-17-52, 58, 68, 69 and 71) with his hands joined together in prayer. The pig (see also nos. 1907-7-17-52 with further comment, 55, 56, 58, 67, 71 and 72) appears on the far left in the foreground. The figures haunting the saint are predominantly monstrous beasts, with just one female nude clearly depicted on the right (two more human heads can be discerned under the arch in the middle background). 1907-7-17-1 to 90 is a so-called sketchbook, dismembered after its acquisition in 1907. A Title Page inscribed in brown ink is at the beginning of the series. Lit.: H. Tietze and E. Tietze-Conrat, 'The Drawings of the Venetian Painters in the 15th and 16th Centuries', New York, 1944, no. 1526/66, p. 265
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Don Gaspar Mendez de Haro y Guzmán, Marchese del Carpio
Acquisition notes: 1907,0717.1 to 90 have been extracted from a XVIIc album with the title 'Disegni di Giacomo Tintoretto raccolti in Roma dall'Eccmo Sig. Don Gasparo d'Haro e Guzman, Marchese del Carpio .... e nel 1682 eletto Vice Re e Capitano Gnle del Regno di Napoli.' The album covers survive and are kept in the Stationary Cupboard.
